inlineContent.text: provides comprehensive access to a user’s Apple Music library,
including methods to fetch, search, and manage library content.

code: let searchResults = try await MLibrary.search(for: "coldplay", types: [Song.self])
try await MLibrary.addPlaylist(name: "My Playlist", description: "My favorite songs")

abstract.text: Structure containing the methods related to the user’s library.
Add multiple songs to the user’s library by using their identifiers.
Adds a rating for an album in the user’s library.
Access the total number of playlists in the user’s library.
Adds a rating for a music item in the user’s library.
Add multiple albums to the user’s library by using their identifiers.
Fetch all genres from the user’s library.
Get the rating for an album in the user’s library.
Adds a rating for a music video in the user’s library.
Fetch all songs from the user’s library for all artists.
Adds an array of songs, identified by their IDs, to a specified playlist in the user’s music library.
Fetch all artists from the user’s library in alphabetical order.
Fetch a song from the user’s library by using its identifier with all properties from the local database.
Taken from https://github.com/marcelmendesfilho/MusadoraKit/blob/feature/improvements/Sources/MusadoraKit/Library/LibrarySong.swift
Thanks @marcelmendesfilho!

Fetch all songs from the user’s library for a specific genre.
Fetch the user’s “Made For You” playlists from their library.
